Description: A terracotta standing dove on a broken flaring stand. The rear part is lost. There is a conical hump on the bird's back, just behind its neck: it is possibly an unpierced suspension-lug. Solid; hand-modelled. Orange-brown Nile silt with a pink and grey core and some mica. Overall cream-coloured slip, with details (eyes, wings) in black and orange-red fired-on ceramic colours.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Donated: Byzantine Research and Publication Fund (BRPF). Excavated by R. Campbell Thompson and F.A. Richards in 1913-14 at Wadi Sarga, 15 miles south of Asyut. [The same as registration no. 1919,0505.316.] Late Roman, about AD 550-650. Comparandum: Not unlike Donadoni 1974: pl. 49:17, a late Roman bird from Antinoopolis. Bibliog: Dalton 1921: 178.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3731)
